articles.title: Yida Chen
articles.contents:
Hi there! I am Yida, a senior undergraduate computer science student at
Bucknell University.


This website hosts a portfolio of my visualizations created for the Prof. Abby
Flynt’s data visualization course.


In addition to the visualization, my past projects focus on automating
the video-based semantic segmentation of sparsely annotated
echocardiogram using deep learning. I have published two papers on this
topic at the SPIE Medical Imaging 2021 and 2022 Conference both with
oral presentations. My work is advised by

Prof. Joshua Stough  (Bucknell University) and

Prof. Christopher Haggerty  (Geisinger).



My presentation at SPIE Medical Imaging 2022 Conference, San Diego, CA.
Recorded
Presentation and Slide
Deck.


I am also the project maintainer for KALMUS, a color analysis toolkit
for film studies. You can find the project’s GitHub Repo here,

KALMUS-Color-Toolkit. The project is supported by the Mellon
Academic Year Research Fellowship awarde by Bucknell Humanities center.


 Screenshot of the KALMUS’
graphic user interface.

articles.title: Narrative Visualization: Key Indicators of Heart Diseases
articles.description: Does physical activity really prevent you from having heart dieases? What's the relationship between your BMI and cardiac health? Check my narrative visualizations below to uncover the key indicators of heart disease!

            Yida Chen Visualization Course Website
          
          
            
              This is my portfolio website for MATH 230: Data
              Visualization!
              You can find the graph/chart/artwork that I made under
              the Course Visualization
              tab. Interested in learning the key indicators of cardiac
              disease? Have a look at my Narrative Visualization: Cardiac
              Health!
              More information about me is available in the About page or my Personal Website.

articles.title: Course Visualization
articles.description: Welcome! This page is a gallery of my visualizations created during the course MATH 230: Data Visualization at Bucknell University.
